definition: to win an honor/to strive to win a prize
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Your laughter flying in the arena, winning glory for the number of classes you best.
sentences.chinese: 你的欢笑飞扬在赛场，为班争光数你最棒。

sentences.english: Gain many prizes for nation. Children all over the world will watch my cartoons.
sentences.chinese: 拿大奖，为国争光，让全世界小孩都看我的动画片。

sentences.english: The desire to win glory for their country impels the athletes to train diligently.
sentences.chinese: 为国争光的志愿激励运动员刻苦训练。

sentences.english: But the Beijing Olympics has made people willing to contribute to the nation's glory.
sentences.chinese: 但是北京奥运会使人们愿意为国争光做贡献。

sentences.english: Competitive gymnastics is the accented of "Program of Striving for Olympic Glory".
sentences.chinese: 竞技体操是我国“奥运争光计划”的一个重点项目。

sentences.english: Her goal is to become a star athlete and make China proud.
sentences.chinese: 她的目标是成为一名体育明星，为国争光。

sentences.english: Every cager must attain good results snd win honour for the country.
sentences.chinese: 每个篮球队员必须创造好成绩，为国争光。

sentences.english: So few athletes have this chance to play in the Olympics for their country.
sentences.chinese: 没几个运动员有这种在奥运赛场上为国争光的机会。

sentences.english: I want to become a star athlete and make China proud.
sentences.chinese: 我想成为一个体育明星，为国争光。

sentences.english: Thomas could be a credit to the school in any station of life.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯不论在哪个岗位上，都能为校争光。

sentences.english: For now, the target for Haier is to create world famous brand and win honour for our country.
sentences.chinese: 当前，海尔的目标是创中国的世界名牌，为民族争光。

sentences.english: I love the collective, collective activities, winning glory for the classes.
sentences.chinese: 我热爱集体，在集体活动中，为班级争光。

sentences.english: Other internet users urged him to continue with his efforts to "win glory for our country."
sentences.chinese: 其他的一些网友则鼓励他继续努力“为国争光”。

sentences.english: Lola and Keiko take every opportunity to stand tall for America.
sentences.chinese: 罗拉和凯克争取一切机会为美利坚争光。

sentences.english: His contributions to science do honor to our country.
sentences.chinese: 他在科学上的贡献为我们国家争光。

definition: lit. contribute bricks and tiles for a building (idiom)/fig. to do one's bit to help
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
to bring honor to one's ancestors
to work hard for sth/to resolve on improvement/determined not to fall short
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
